section.name: Install
section.p: There is two parts of Packet Spy; the java library and the native library. The java library (packetspy-X.X.jar) must be placed in the CLASSPATH of the application using Packet Spy. The native library (packetspy-X.X.dll under windows or libpacketspy-X.X.so under *nix) must be addded to the java library path.

Under *nix platforms such as Linux you need to set the environment variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH to include the directory that the libpacketspy-X.X.so library is included. Assuming that packetspy is installed in /usr/local/packetspy-X.X then you need to do something like the following;
Under windows platforms you need to copy the packetspy-X.X.dll library to either the windows system directory or preferrably into the working directory of the application using Packet Spy.

The user also needs to install the underlying packet capture library. Under windows this is WinPCap and under *nix based systems this is libpcap. See the links page for where to download and install the library from.
